page.title: 03LIFESTYLE.ST.PETER'S COTTAGE
page.content: In the Church Path there is a welcoming restaurant owned by Mr. Peter Ashmole.Parts of the half timbered building are 700 years old and some of the walls are made of wattle and daub. Climbing roses cover the outer walls. Outside there is a lovely garden with a well.Roman numbers are carved on the ceiling beams and there is an old brick fireplace.70 people can be seated in the 3 rooms. Morning Coffee costs 48p.A 3 course lunch costs Â£5.00.Afternoon Tea Â£1.20.Many tourists visit the restaurant as well as regular customers.It has been awarded 4 Badges to show its quality. Mr.Ashmole plans to serve evening meals in the future.There is also a shop which sells honey and jam, pottery and souvenirs.
